summary:
AS Roma's match against Bologna in the Stadio Olimpico was one marked by dramatic action and some sublime football moments, ending in a decisive 3-0 victory for the home side. The atmosphere inside the stadium was electric as the game began, with the opening whistle signaling the start of what would be an eventful 90 minutes.

The match kicked off with AS Roma taking control, but within just 19 seconds, the ball went out of play. Bologna quickly took a throw-in but was unable to keep the ball in play for long. At the 1:05 mark, Bologna had the first notable attempt on goal with a shot off target. This early effort signaled their intent, but it went wide, giving AS Roma a chance to regroup and clear the ball at 1:28.

Both teams struggled to settle down, with multiple pauses as the ball kept going out of play, notably resulting in several throw-ins for Bologna. The visitors earned a corner at 3:12, but AS Roma's defense was resolute, clearing the danger. Moments later, AS Roma committed a foul, gifting Bologna a free-kick that went unconverted as they failed to make any significant impact. Another corner at 4:45 was again fended off by the Roma defense.

By the 7:02 mark, AS Roma began to assert themselves offensively. A shot on target teased the home fans, though the subsequent effort went wide. Edin Dzeko found himself with a golden opportunity near the edge of the box at around the 10-minute mark, but his shot narrowly missed the right post, much to the relief of the Bologna defense.

AS Roma’s persistence paid off in the 12th minute when Mohamed Salah found himself in the right place at the right time. Picking up the ball inside the box, Salah fired a shot that deflected past Bologna’s goalkeeper, Angelo da Costa, opening the scoring and giving AS Roma a desirable 1-0 lead.

Bologna immediately kicked off, trying to get back on terms. Saphir Taider sent in a lofted cross at 13:30, which the Roma defense cleared efficiently. Bologna’s frustration grew as a foul thwarted one of their attacking movements almost immediately after a corner effort.

As the match progressed, the ball frequently went out of play, turning the game into a somewhat fragmented affair. Both teams continued their tussles, but neither could establish sustained control. Edin Dzeko and Diego Perotti were active for AS Roma, trying to carve out opportunities, while Bologna's defense was kept on their toes.

Around the 28-minute mark, Umar Sadiq of Bologna unleashed a well-aimed shot, forcing Roma’s goalkeeper, Wojciech Szczesny, into a crucial save. This was one of the few clear cut chances created by Bologna, who struggled to break down a disciplined Roma defense.

AS Roma continued to push forward, with Salah once again in the thick of the action, launching several efforts on target. Salah's pace and positioning were a handful for Bologna’s backline. Meanwhile, referees were busy too; a series of fouls dictated the play's rhythm, culminating in Radja Nainggolan’s foul that gave Bologna yet another indirect free-kick.

Near the half's closing stages, chances emerged for both sides. An impressive strike by Juan Jesus seemed destined to double Roma's lead, but an agile save by da Costa denied the moment. As the half drew to its conclusion, AS Roma's control of the ball and ability to maintain defensive solidity were clear.

The half-time whistle blew, taking us into the break with Roma leading. As the second half began, Bologna kicked off, intent on finding the equalizer. Fouls continued to punctuate the play’s early rhythm. An offside call against Bologna reflected their struggle with timing and organization in attack.

Soon, Mohamed Salah reaffirmed his influence; his dangerous cross moments after a missed header kept Bologna’s defense wary. Multiple changes were made, with Bologna substituting Umar Sadiq for Mattia Destro in a bid to introduce fresh legs and ideas into their attack.

However, it was AS Roma who struck again. In a beautiful display of precision and composure, Salah received a killer pass, and facing off with the goalkeeper, swiftly sent the ball into the net at 16:50, further piling misery on Bologna and marking his second goal of the match. This gave the home side a comfortable 2-0 advantage.

Bologna did not ease up despite the growing deficit. Federico Viviani attempted a shot from a distance but lacked the requisite accuracy, disappointing the traveling fans. AS Roma pressed hard again and found joy for the third time. Another scramble in Bologna's box saw Edin Dzeko shoot from the edge of the penalty area, only for his shot to be saved. However, Salah pounced on the rebound, securing his hat-trick, with the scoreline reading 3-0.

Leandro Paredes was shown a yellow card for an unnecessary foul, but Bologna couldn’t capitalize on the ensuing free-kick. The home team's control was almost complete; their defense was resolute, their midfield cohesive, and their attack relentless. The tactical substitutions like Gerson replacing Bruno Peres indicated the precision with which Roma managed their squad through the game’s final stages.

There were still moments of resistance from Bologna, who garnered opportunities. Erick Pulgar, brought on to stabilize the midfield, had an impactful shot saved magnificently by Szczesny. This was among the few moments Bologna appeared genuinely threatening. Their set-pieces, including corners delivered by Ladislav Krejci, failed to break down Roma’s defense.

Roma’s substitutions and game management were impeccable, such as bringing on Stephan El Shaarawy to replace the beaming hat-trick hero, Salah, ensuring that fresh players maintained the high intensity. Despite the commanding lead, Roma displayed professionalism to see out the remaining minutes without conceding.

Bologna made a final substitution, with Vassilios Torosidis replacing Adam Masina, aiming perhaps for at least a consolation goal, but to no avail. AS Roma managed to break down any vestige of Bologna's composure and continually stifled them with disciplined defensive placements and effective clearances.

The final whistle confirmed a comprehensive victory for AS Roma. The fans in the Stadio Olimpico evidently got their money’s worth; their team’s supremacy on the pitch in both halves was emphatic. The commanding display showcased balance, tactical nous, and flawless execution, particularly in the decisive quality of Salah, who notched up a memorable hat-trick.

In summary, AS Roma emerged dominantly against Bologna with an authoritative 3-0 win, marked by numerous goal attempts, strategic fouls, and vigorous defensive stances from both sides. Despite occasional offensive forays by Bologna, Roma’s clinical finishing and superior strategy led to an indelible victory, maintaining their pursuit in the league with remarkable prowess and skill.
